text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello my name is mulai a cloud support
engineer here at AWS office in Dublin
today I'm going to show you how to
troubleshoot the container health check
failure for Amazon elastic container
service task let's get
started if you receive the following
error then the containers in your Amazon
ECS task are using health checks that
your service can't
pass to troubleshoot and resolve this
error follow these steps before you
provision a container in Amazon ECS
locally test the container to make sure
that it passes the container health
checks confirm that the command that you
pass to the container is correct and
that you use the correct sentence for
your Amazon ECS task give your container
enough time to initiate if your Amazon e
task continue to run for an extended
time then check your application logs
and Amazon cloudwatch
logs let go through each of these steps
locally test the container to make sure
that it passes the container health
check access your command line interface
edit your Docker file to include health
check build a image from your Docker
file run your
image check the container health check
status with the docker PS or doer
container
LS note
Amazon ECS doesn't monitor Docker health
check that are embedded in a container
image and aren't specified in the
container definition health check
parameter are specified in a container
definition overwrite Docker health check
that exist in the container
image confirm that you use the correct
Syntax for your Amazon ECS task
if you use the AWS command line then run
this
command if you use the AWS Management
console Jon panel log into the console
select the
region navigate to Amazon elastic
container service select the task
definition that you are troubleshooting
check that the commands and syntax are
correct note don't separate the health
check command with double quates such
as instead use the following command
syntax give your container enough time
to initiate
if your container takes a long time to
initiate then your container can fail
the container health check to resolve
this issue set the start period in the
advanced container definition parameter
this give your Amazon easiest task time
to boost STP before any failed health
check are included in the maximum number
of
retes for task that are running for a
long time check your application logs
and Cloud watch logs if your Amazon ECS
task is running for a long time and fail
the container health check then check
your application logs if your Amazon ECS
task use AWS logs log driver then check
your application logs on cloud
watch open the AWS Management console
then select select the
region navigate to Cloud
watch select the log
group check your application
logs note AWS farget is a managed
service this means that you can't access
the underlying infrastructure to
troubleshoot this issue launch your
Amazon ECS tasks in Amazon elastic
compute Cloud then use SSH to connect to
your Amazon ec2 instances you can also
use Amazon ECS exact to interact
directly with your ECS
containers so now you know how to
troubleshoot the container health check
failures for Amazon ECS tasks
thank you for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Music]
[Applause]
